page.title: 12Childhood in the 1900s (1)
page.content: Mrs Andrews lives in Croxdale. She's lived in the area nearly all her life. She was born there in 1900, in a house opposite the old colliery. From her window she could see the red brick chimney with the date 1875 in white bricks, the date the pit was sunk. Her father worked there and he once took her down with him. She said it was aweful. She saw the poor pit ponies which pulled the trucks of coal. The miners used to take a canary down with them to test for gas. She liked walking. She would gather flowers and knew all their names. She played games with her friends in the road outside her home, games like chucks, hop-scotch, bowling a hoop and tops and whips. It was safe then to play in the roads because there were no cars or buses.
